infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container does not drop all default capabilities
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

remediation.kubernetes: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`
remediation.terraform: Add `ALL` to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities to `spec.container.security_context.capabilities.add`, ensuring it also does not contain `ALL`

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container has no CPU limit
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: CPU limits can prevent containers from consuming valuable compute time for no benefit (e.g. inefficient code) that might lead to unnecessary costs. It is advisable to also configure CPU requests to ensure application stability.
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

remediation.kubernetes: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
remediation.terraform: Add `spec.container.resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

infrastructureAsCodeIssues.title: Container's or Pod's  UID could clash with host's UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.issue: `runAsUser` value is set to low UID
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass
infrastructureAsCodeIssues.resolve: Set `securityContext.runAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10'000. SecurityContext can be set on both `pod` and `container` level. If both are set, then the container level takes precedence

remediation.kubernetes: Set `securityContext.runAsUser` value to greater or equal than 10'000. SecurityContext can be set on both `pod` and `container` level. If both are set, then the container level takes precedence
remediation.terraform: Set `security_context.run_as_user` value to greater or equal than 10'000

iacDescription.issue: `runAsUser` value is set to low UID
